instruction.instructionnorm: To complete the activity, select each statement at the top, then click its category below. Replay this interaction as many times as you need. There is no time limit. Your responses will not be graded.

draggableitem.item: Student useds eight emojis during a five-minute text message conversation.
I counted four grammatical errors in student's email to the professor.
Analysis of student's tweets reveals 20% are about school, 50% about work, and 30% about friends.
Student's FaceTime calls averaged 15 minutes during the past week.
Student used three different greetings when answering the phone at work.
Student seemed more reserved when speaking with family than in other settings.
Student's use of profanity changed when they started losing the game.
Student's tone on the phone was friendlier early in the shift than it was later in the shift.
Student seems comfortable using scientific jargon.
Student often uses phone as a sign of disengagement.

feedback.rightans: Correct! You've matched each type of research data to its category. You understand that qualitative data includes subjective information based on observations and quantitative data can be replicated in a controlled environment.
